results.title: Tomorrow's salmon
results.creator_credit: Michael Maltby, National Film Board of Canada and Nielsen-Ferns International
results.brief_description: The film describes the joint program of the Canadian and British Columbian governments to protect and strengthen stocks of Pacific salmon on which depend, either directly or indirectly, the jobs of 75,000 people and a $250 million industry. Well-documented and visually satisfying, the film alerts its audience to the necessity of sound conservation practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Maltby, National Film Board of Canada and Nielsen-Ferns International

results.title: The Year of living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Jim McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: Set in Indonesia during the 1965 civil strife, this adaptation of the of the novel by C.J. Koch, concentrates on a small group of journalists in Jakarta, who are covering the crisis, and the strange three-way relationship between an Australian correspondent, his extraordinary Chinese-Australian cameraman and the woman they both love.

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 1
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, diet and nutrition, growth, the value of exercise and sleep, germs and how to take care of the teeth.

results.title: Zea
results.creator_credit: Andre Leduc, Jean-Jacques Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A superb visual trick that will mystify its audience, this animated film transforms the commonplace into magic. The film presented a serious technical challenge because the subject was both elusive and explosive. A film to watch, enjoy and laugh about. Film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andre Leduc, Jean-Jacques Leduc, Robert Forget and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Zardip's search for healthy wellness. Part 2
results.brief_description: This series uses live action, animation and song to promote an awareness and understanding of how the body works and what it needs to stay healthy. In ten episodes, Zardip, a friendly alien, learns about the human body, and people and places which care for our health. This program looks at the dentis and doctor, hospitals and operations, ears and eyes, safety and environmental health and feelings. Finally, Zardip is able to attain the healthy wellness he had been seeking.

results.title: Yudie
results.creator_credit: Mirra Bank and New Day Films
results.brief_description: An old Jewish lady talks about her life on the East Side of New York City particularly recalling the strong sense of community and the concern felt by old migrants for newer ones.

results.title: Youth and music
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The National Gallery of Canada serves the Canadian public in many ways. This film tours the galleries in Ottawa where the national collection of old masters, as well as modern works, are on display. It shows how the Gallery helps foster art appreciation. Behind the scenes we see another phase of the work of art—the cleaning, preservation and storing of art treasures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Jutra, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Tomten
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Tomten, a magical being of Swedish legend, which lives in the corner of a hayloft on a lonely old farm. The Tomten creeps around the farm, speaking Tomten, “a silent little language”, that animals can understand, while lamenting the fact that the people are asleep and cannot talk to him. Based on a poem by Victor Rydberg, adapted by Astrid Lindgren, illustrated by Harold Wiberg.

results.title: Yu Opera performers [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Directed, photographed and edited by Liu Shumin, this documentary film presents an intimate view into the lives of husband and wife team, Zhao Feng and Lu Ronghua, Xi’an’s famous Yu Opera performers. Yu Opera emerged during the late Ming Dynasty and is designed more for the broad masses with its stories of social themes and the working class. It is mostly dominated by singing opera arias with minimal make-up, costuming and acting and performed at traditional Tea-houses. The documentary includes behind-the-scenes and backstage operations and negotiations as the local Henan TV Station prepare a live-to-air performance of their Art Troupe featuring Lu Ronghua and Zhao Feng. It also follows Lu and Zhao’s bid to establish their own Teahouse - their financial problems, legal negotiations and the long and frustrating bureaucratical system that keeps on hindering them from achieving their ambition of bringing traditional Chinese culture to the masses. Shumin’s photography is quite evocative, particularly his images of the Chinese landscape, and although the film is at times slow-moving, it still provides a most interesting insight into Chinese customs, daily life and Yu Opera. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Serial experiments: Lain. Vol. 01: Navi
results.creator_credit: Akihiko Nishiyama, Johei Matsuura, Ryutaro Nakamura, Haruyo Kanesaku, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Genco and Pioneer LDCE
results.brief_description: Japanese animated series “Lain”, Volume 01 “Navi”, episodes (layers) 1, 2, 3 and 4. Lain is an introverted thirteen year old schoolgirl who is startled to receive emails from a fellow classmate, Chisa, who has recently committed suicide. Chisa tells Lain about where she lives, “The Wired” (a euphemism for the Internet), an alternate reality where minds roam freely unencumbered by their mortal body. “Weird” Episode 1 (or layer one) establishes Lain’s isolation from her emotionally remote family, and her eagerness to form relationships in the cyber world when she fails to connect with those in the real world. Episode 2, “Girls”: Lain suspects she has an alternate personality operating on the Wired, an uncontrollable alter ego that is the opposite of her true self. When a killer, high on mind-altering drugs runs amok in a nightclub, Lain is mysteriously spared. Episode 3, “Psyche”: Lain is being trailed by several mysterious men in black and gets unusual mental communications regarding the set-up of the Wired. A package, enabling unencumbered access to The Wired, is anonymously delivered. Episode 4, “Religion”: now engrossed with cyberspace, Lain modifies her computer, gaining extensive access to the Wired. Conceptually, “Lain” is comparable to the classic definition of cyberpunk - a paranoid moral and psychological parable that centres on the relationships between people and technology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Akihiko Nishiyama, Johei Matsuura, Ryutaro Nakamura, Haruyo Kanesaku, Hiroe Tsukamoto, Yutaka Maseba, Genco and Pioneer LDCE
